boat.construction_details: Iroko planking on steamed oak timbers. Epoxy sheathed plywood deck. Some original deck is iroko on plywood base

for_sales.sales_text:
"Anita" was built in 1972 on the River Crouch as an oyster dredger. Built of iroko on oak and designed by Watson. Bought by the current owners in 2005 out of fishing and converted into a comfortable and versatile cruiser over a number of years.

Cruised around the Thames Estuary and to the navigable head of the Thames, the Norfolk Broads and through the Kennet and Avon Canal to Bristol. 5 berths in two cabins. New 50hp Beta engine in 2012 and most ancillary equipment new in the last 10 years. Hot water system and cabin heating.

A well maintained boat ready to go, suitable for coastal cruising and inland waterways of Great Britain and Europe.

boat.full_description:
Originally built for Oystering on the Crouch, possibly for a Mr Deval. When the business failed Pym moved to Brightlingsea as a trawler. Her name was changed by her new owner Chris Scott to Anita. his wife's name. He kept her for 30 years and put in a new engine.

In 2005 Anita was bought by Brian Kennell and his wife Sally, and over the next 6 years she was reconfigured into a comfortable cruiser. In this guise she has cruised extensively, visiting the tidal and non-tidal Thames as far as Lechlade, the Norfolk Broads, and the Kennett and Avon canal all the way to Bristol.

Anita is a versatile boat capable of coastal cruising, but with a demountable wheelhouse to enable her to pass under bridges with as little as 6' headroom.
boat.name: Anita
boat.short_description: Anita was built as a fishing boat, then converted for leisure
